item.title: Comment on Online code formatters by Chris Waller

item.description: I would also recommend one free online sql beautifier - http://www.sql-format.com/ works solid and has plenty of formatting options.
item.content:encoded: I would also recommend one free online sql beautifier – http://www.sql-format.com/ works solid and has plenty of formatting options.

item.title: Comment on Concatenating child rows in SQL – Cross Apply / FOR XML PATH by Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan

item.title: Comment on Concatenating child rows in SQL – Cross Apply / FOR XML PATH by Oscar
item.dc:creator: Oscar
item.description:
to get rid of the comma you can use STUFF... in Ryan's example you would basically declare your columns and 'STUFF' the one with the results of the CROSS APPLY like this:
SELECT OrderID, OrderNotes, STUFF(listOfLineNotes,1,1,'') as listOfLineNotes FROM orders AS o CROSS APPLY ( SELECT linenotes + ',' FROM orderLines AS ol WHERE ol.orderID = o.orderID FOR XML PATH('') ) temp ( listOfLineNotes )
item.content:encoded:
to get rid of the comma you can use STUFF… in Ryan’s example you would basically declare your columns and ‘STUFF’ the one with the results of the CROSS APPLY like this:

SELECT OrderID, OrderNotes, STUFF(listOfLineNotes,1,1,”) as listOfLineNotes
FROM orders AS o
CROSS APPLY (
SELECT linenotes + ‘,’
FROM orderLines AS ol
WHERE ol.orderID = o.orderID
FOR XML PATH(”) )
temp ( listOfLineNotes )

item.title: Comment on Wrapping tabs in ColdFusion 9 by KS

item.description: Thanks - My nested tabs were blowing out the page and this simple fixed saved my day!
item.content:encoded: Thanks – My nested tabs were blowing out the page and this simple fixed saved my day!

item.title: Comment on Elegant pagination with MS SQL 2005 by negablog
item.dc:creator: negablog
item.description: Great solution for getting total number of records using Count(*) Over(). The over() solves the purpose, without it aggregate function error will throw.. Thanks a lot for writting.
item.content:encoded:
Great solution for getting total number of records using Count(*) Over(). The over() solves the purpose, without it aggregate function error will throw..
Thanks a lot for writting.

item.title: Comment on Did you know about the onerror attribute of the img tag? by Wayne
item.dc:creator: Wayne
item.description:
Just read: http://jquery-howto.blogspot.de/2013/01/8-methods-that-will-not-work-in-jquery.html
.error() added in v1.0, deprecated in v1.8. Not to be confused with $.error() method, that throws new Error(msg);
item.content:encoded:
Just read: http://jquery-howto.blogspot.de/2013/01/8-methods-that-will-not-work-in-jquery.html

.error() added in v1.0, deprecated in v1.8. Not to be confused with $.error() method, that throws new Error(msg);
